model
Class CollidableObject

java.lang.Object
  model.CollidableObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMessageSender
Direct Known Subclasses:
AmmoCrate, ConcreteCollidableObject, Entity, MedPack, Portal
public abstract class CollidableObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMessageSender

The collidable object super class.

Consists of a collision box, a size, and offsets. The size is the actual size of the object - picture it like the area rendered on screen, including the sprite. The collision box is the rectangular area that actually determines if the object hits another CollidableObject's collision box. You may not want the collision box to be positioned in the upper left corner of the object, so there are two properties - the vertical and horizontal offset - to offset the collision box from the corner. Thus, the object may have a collision box smaller than the object's size, and may not cover the whole object's area.

Author:
Johan

Constructor Detail

CollidableObject

public CollidableObject(java.awt.Rectangle collBox,
                        java.awt.Dimension size,
                        int xoffset,
                        int yoffset)
A collidable object with a collision box, size, and offsets for the collision box. The object will get its position from collBox's position.

Parameters:
collBox - The collision box
size - The size of the model
xoffset - The X offset of the collision box
yoffset - The Y offset of the collision box

isColliding

public boolean isColliding(CollidableObject obj)
Check whether this object is colliding with another CollidableObject. The objects are colliding if their collision boxes intersect.

Parameters:
obj - The specified CollidableObject
Returns:
True if the objects are colliding, false otherwise
